user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: #T4E Best tip I ever heard for being persuasive in a meeting (and I use it all the time): Avoid the temptation to speak first. Speak last.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: @joekraus3 great to have you on Twitter dad!

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: T4E. Opportunity creates opportunity in ways difficult to predict. Strive to say yes to the opportunities presented.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: @mikejkim can't believe Nate pooped in the yard. Too funny.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: Daughters 2nd birthday today. Bounce house and, wait for it, pony rides! She's been singing 'happy birthday to me' for days.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: T4E A lesson I learned at Google. Speed is *the* key feature of ur product. Easy to get caught up in other features & forget speed. Don't.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: @acharoo  Most people aren't explicit about it. They want success but aren't willing to do things like hire people better than themselves.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: #T4E  Control or Success? When you start your company, you need to decide *explicitly* which one you care most about. Don't skip this.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: #T4E You spend 10 hours/day thinking about your product. Your potential customers evaluate it in 5 seconds. Keep it simple and be different!

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: #T4E 'Hire fast, fire fast' is false entrepreneurial religion.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: #T4E  build products for yourself. your product needs to be a part of *your* daily life. being the customer makes a vastly better product.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: Truly amazing art from folds in paper. http://bit.ly/TawzW

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: #T4E  Entrepreneurs should *never* be afraid of big companies unless you are aiming at the very core of their business.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: #T4E  In the tech world, we often try solving problems/disputes thru email or IM. Don't. Get in a room. People solve problems face to face.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: @thinkoutloud #t4e stands for 'tips for entrepreneurs' and it's meant for any helpful tidbits for, no surprise, entrepreneurs.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: Watching @fredwilson talk at Google. The first tech talk I've attended in 2.5 years here.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: #T4E Making other people feel listened to and truly heard, even if u don't agree with them, is at the heart of leadership. Develop that skil

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: #T4E Don't talk past the close! Once you get what you came for, get out. Too many get what they want, continue to sell and then lose it.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: @ryangoins  should be fixed now.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: #T4E Take time to celebrate your successes. We tend to focus on the next challenge without stopping to recognize the one we just overcame.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: @ryangoins  i think we now understand the issue. i'll keep you posted as to a fix

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: #T4E my favorite product philosophy: 'extend a strength before shoring up a weakness.' As u think about v2 of ur product keep this in mind.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: Liked @lechwe idea. TFE is now T4E.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: TFE: hire slowly and never in desperation. that urgent hire you must have *right now* often turns out to feel unnecessary in 3 months.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: @ryangoins looking into your google profiles issue.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: TFE: learning to trust yourself and your own judgement is a life-long mission for entrepreneurs.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: TFE: build your metrics dashboard *before* you launch. If you don't it a) takes months to do and b) has you flying blind in a crucial time.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: TFE: focus on Operational Tempo. How fast are your release cycles? Product decisions? It's a virtuous cycle. Speed leads 2 more speed.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: At the Van Morisson concert with my wife and @kteare. Please don't rain. Please.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: TFE: rarely can one company affect the trajectory of another. Focus on your company, instead of trying to "do" something to the competition

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: Got my picture with McLovin at the Star Trek premiere after party. Chicky-chicky-yeah!

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: TFE: persistence, more than any other ability, is the key to success. So many of my paths to "yes" began when someone first said "no".

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: Going to Star trek world premiere tonight in LA. Got my Klingon dictionary. Who's with me!?

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: TFE: startups = emo rollercoaster. One day u go home & things feel terrible. Next day things feel awesome. But nothing has actually changed.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: TFE: When you raise your 1st round of $, immediately create the *ideal* slide deck for raising your 2nd. These are your new company goals

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: TFE = Tip for Entrepreneurs. Taking too much of my precious character limit

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: tip for entrepreneurs: Your goal? make $100 in your first month after launch. Then $300, $1000 etc. Launch with your biz model. Do not delay

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: I liked @jhuber review of my Tesla. "it's a cross between a go kart and a golf cart". U have no idea how true that is.

user.name: Joe Kraus
user.description: Long-time entrepreneur. Current partner at Google Ventures

text: tip for entrepreneurs: extend an existing user habit with your product, don't try and create a new one.

user.name: Joe Kraus

text: want to try and experiment: post an entrepreneurial tweet every weekday
